entry.title: Encryping data with Magento!
entry.content:
Encrypting a string in Magneto is really easy and will use the encryption key specified in the local.xml file:

```php

<?php $encryptedData = Mage::helper(‘core’)–>encrypt(“This will be encrypted”);

```

There is one problem that you may encounter that can be a little bit problematic but there is an easy work around. The encryption process will strip out non-printing characters or character it does not recognise. Easiest way to get about this is to base64 encode what you are about to encrypt:

```php

<?php $encryptedData = Mage::helper(‘core’)–>encrypt(base64_encode(“\n\rI start with a carriage return”));

```

Decrypting is just as easy:

```php

<?php $decyptedData = Mage::helper(‘core’)–>decrypt($encryptedData);

```

Remember to base64_decode after decryption if you did base64 encode before encryption: ```php

<?php $decyptedData = base64_decode(Mage::helper(‘core’)–>decrypt($encryptedData));

```
